p: Among the ssRNA viruses, positive-strand RNA viruses were in the minority (1.96% of ssRNA viruses). More than 98% of sequences were taxonomically related to Trinbago virus, a BLTV4-related virus identified in Trinidad and Tobago Rh. sanguineus ticks (Sameroff et al., 2019). The strain identified in Thai ticks, tentatively named BLTV4-Thailand virus (accession no. MN095535) presented a mean amino-acid identity of 93% with the polyprotein of Trinbago virus ( Table 1). Other positive-strand ssRNA viruses were less frequently identified and were assigned to the Hepacivirus and Pestivirus genera (more likely corresponding to cattle-infecting viruses that are detected through the bloodmeal of ticks), or to the Luteoviridae family ( Table 1).
